tags.string: {string} id - The ID of the Dataset.
tags.name: id

description.full:
Interact with your BigQuery dataset. Create a Dataset instance with
{module:bigquery#createDataset} or {module:bigquery#dataset}.
description.summary:
Interact with your BigQuery dataset. Create a Dataset instance with
{module:bigquery#createDataset} or {module:bigquery#dataset}.

tags.string: {object} options - Table id or configuration object.
tags.name: options

tags.string: {string} options.id - The id of the table.
tags.name: options.id

tags.string:
{string|object} options.schema - A comma-separated list of name:type
    pairs. Valid types are "string", "integer", "float", "boolean", and
    "timestamp". If the type is omitted, it is assumed to be "string".
    Example: "name:string, age:integer". Schemas can also be specified as a
    JSON array of fields, which allows for nested and repeated fields. See
    a [Table resource](http://goo.gl/sl8Dmg) for more detailed information.
tags.name: options.schema
tags.description:
• A comma-separated list of name:type pairs. Valid types are "string", "integer", "float", "boolean", and
    "timestamp". If the type is omitted, it is assumed to be "string".
    Example: "name:string, age:integer". Schemas can also be specified as a
    JSON array of fields, which allows for nested and repeated fields. See
    a Table resource for more detailed information.

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this request
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request

tags.html:
var tableConfig = {
id: 'institution_data',

// From the data.gov CSV dataset (http://goo.gl/kSE7z6):
schema: 'UNITID,INSTNM,ADDR,CITY,STABBR,ZIP,FIPS,OBEREG,CHFNM,...'
};

var bigquery = gcloud.bigquery({
projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123'
});
var dataset = bigquery.dataset();

dataset.createTable(tableConfig, function(err, table, apiResponse) {});

description.full: Create a table given a tableId or configuration object.
description.summary: Create a table given a tableId or configuration object.

tags.string:
{boolean} options.force - Force delete dataset and all tables.
    Default: false.
tags.name: options.force
tags.description: • Force delete dataset and all tables. Default: false.

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this request
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request

tags.html:
//-
// Delete the dataset, only if it does not have any tables.
//-
dataset.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {});

//-
// Delete the dataset and any tables it contains.
//-
dataset.delete({ force: true }, function(err, apiResponse) {});

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this request
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request

tags.string: {number} query.maxResults - Maximum number of results to return.
tags.name: query.maxResults

tags.string:
{string} query.pageToken - Token returned from a previous call, to
    request the next page of results.
tags.name: query.pageToken
tags.description: • Token returned from a previous call, to request the next page of results.

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this request
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request

tags.string:
{module:bigquery/table[]} callback.tables - The list of tables from
    your Dataset.
tags.name: callback.tables
tags.description: • The list of tables from your Dataset.

tags.string:
{?object} callback.nextQuery - If present, query with this object to
    check for more results.
tags.name: callback.nextQuery
tags.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

tags.html:
dataset.getTables(function(err, tables, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
// If nextQuery is non-null, there are more results to fetch.
});

//-
// Get the tables as a readable object stream.
// table is a Table object
//-
dataset.getTables()
.on('error', console.error)
.on('data', function(table) {})
.on('end', function() {
// All tables have been retrieved
});

//-
// If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent
// unnecessary processing and API requests.
//-
dataset.getTables()
.on('data', function(table) {
this.end();
});

description.full:
Run a query scoped to your dataset.

See {module:bigquery#query} for full documentation of this method.
description.summary: Run a query scoped to your dataset.
description.body: See {module:bigquery#query} for full documentation of this method.

tags.string: {object} metadata - Metadata to save on the Dataset.
tags.name: metadata

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this request
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request

tags.html:
var metadata = {
description: 'Information for every institution in the 2013 IPEDS universe'
};

dataset.setMetadata(metadata, function(err, apiResponse) {});

description.full: Sets the metadata of the Dataset object.
description.summary: Sets the metadata of the Dataset object.

tags.string: {string} id - The ID of the table.
tags.name: id

description.full: Return a new instance of reference to an existing Table object.
description.summary: Return a new instance of reference to an existing Table object.

description.full:
Pass through this request to BigQuery's request handler, first prepending the
path with the dataset.
description.summary:
Pass through this request to BigQuery's request handler, first prepending the
path with the dataset.

description.full:
Developer Documentation

These methods can be used with either a callback or as a readable object
stream. streamRouter is used to add this dual behavior.
description.body:
These methods can be used with either a callback or as a readable object
stream. streamRouter is used to add this dual behavior.
